page.title: 09CORBRIDGE DAY CENTRE
page.content: Corbridge Day Centre,for old and infirm people is held weekly in the Parish Hall.One lady,who had suffered a stroke,has attended for some years. Unable to walk unaided,she is collected by special bus at ten o'clock and helped into the Centre. Coffee and biscuits are served as soon as everyone is comfortable.Most people take part in craft work,knitting and crochet work,or making coloured strips for blankets for the needy.There is a friendly atmosphere among those attending.Lunch,which is served at twelve o'clock,is typically a meal of roast beef,Yorkshire pudding,two vegetables,ginger pudding and custard following.A pleasant afternoon is spent playing cards or dominoes, followed by tea and scones.
